title: Why teenagers are mentoring senior Met Police officers
description: Three teenagers have mentored a trio of the Met’s top women officers over the last six months.

title: In India, growing clamour to criminalise rape within marriage
description: An Indian court ruled that forced sex with a spouse is not rape. Campaigners say it's time for new laws.

title: Japan's huge army of under-employed ex-housewives
description: Why women are still battling for better jobs in the world's third largest economy.

title: 'A once-in-a-generation player' - who made Garth Crooks' team of the week?
description: Who is a once-in-a-generation player? Which forward is not "particularly gifted" but playing the "football of his life"? Find out in Garth Crooks' team of the week.

title: Possum skin cloaks: Reviving an Aboriginal cultural tradition
description: Indigenous people in south-east Australia are reviving an expression of cultural identity.

title: US Open 2021 preview: Djokovic chases history, Murray & Osaka play, no Williams, Federer, Nadal
description: Novak Djokovic is the centre of attention as he bids to win an historic 21st Grand Slam men's title at a US Open missing some of the big-name stars.

title: Rain-hit Belgian Grand Prix 'a farce' - Hamilton
description: Lewis Hamilton criticises the Belgian Grand Prix as 'a farce' and accused Formula 1 of cynicism in the way it ran the rain-hit race.

title: Cristiano Ronaldo: Man Utd fans & players celebrate CR7's return
description: Cristiano Ronaldo may have been in Portugal, but he was everywhere at Molineux.

title: John Simpson on Afghanistan: A country abandoned
description: As foreign forces end their 20-year campaign, our world affairs editor considers what has been achieved.

title: Afghanistan: Taxi driver, shopkeeper: UK victims of Kabul attack
description: Relatives and friends of Mohammad Niazi and Musa Popal pay tribute after Thursday's blasts.

title: Afghanistan: 'Thousands more left behind...and feel terrified'
description: The BBC's Lyse Doucet in Kabul says many people are still desperately trying to leave, as evacuations draw to a close.
